page.title: 19 Arthur Evans - Boars Hill
page.content: Sir Arthur Evans, an archeologist of note, lived on Boars Hill until his death in 1942. Sir Arthur took a keen interest in the young people of the area. In 1926 he created a "wild garden" to become known as Jarn Mound so that young people could explore nature. Jarn Mound still exists today and is a popular spot for visitors. In 1913 Sir Arthur donated 40 acres of his estate for the benefit of young people, particularly the Scouting Movement. Known as Youlbury Camp, it accommodate up to 600 scouts at a time and provides week end & summer camps for scouts from all over the country. Facilities include archery, climbing, swimming, canoing and small bore shooting. There is a nature trail and an "Oxford" trail where scouts are given an opportunity to explore Oxford.
